```{python}
import pandas as pd
file_path = "C:\\Users\\arifm\\OneDrive\\Documents\\GitHub\\DAP-II-Final-project-Polio-trends-\\polio cases data_mahnoor.csv"
polio_data = pd.read_csv (file_path)
```




```{python}
polio_data.head()
```


```{python}
columns_to_keep = ['IndicatorCode', 'Indicator', 'SpatialDimValueCode', 'Location', 'Period', 'Value']
polio_data_cleaned = polio_data[columns_to_keep]
```


```{python}
polio_data_cleaned.head()
```


```{python}
# Rename the columns in the DataFrame
polio_data_cleaned = polio_data_cleaned.rename(columns={
    'Value': 'reported_cases',
    'SpatialDimValueCode': 'country_code',
    'Location': 'country_name',
    'Period': 'year'
    'IndicatorCode : indicator_code'
})

# Display the first few rows of the cleaned DataFrame
print("Renamed Columns:")
print(polio_data_cleaned.head())

```

```{python}
polio_data_cleaned.head()
```


```{python}
output_file_path = "C:\\Users\\arifm\\OneDrive\\Documents\\GitHub\\DAP-II-Final-project-Polio-trends-"  
polio_data_cleaned.to_csv(output_file_path, index=False)

```


```{python}
# Filter for years between 2000 and 2022
filtered_data = polio_data_cleaned[
    (polio_data_cleaned['year'] >= 2000) & 
    (polio_data_cleaned['year'] <= 2022)
]

# Further filter for positive polio cases
positive_cases_data = filtered_data[filtered_data['reported_cases'] > 0]

# Display the filtered data
print("Countries with positive cases from 2000 to 2022:")
print(positive_cases_data[['country_code', 'country_name', 'year', 'reported_cases']].head())
```
